title: The Ultimate Golden Gate Park Drive
subtitle: Nature, museums, and winding park roads
description: A 2-hour leisurely cruise through one of the world's greatest urban parks. See Victorian greenhouses, world-class museums, historic windmills, and real bison, all culminating where the park meets the mighty Pacific Ocean.

stops.name: The Panhandle
stops.description: Enter the park through this historic, narrow strip of lush greenery that points the way into the main expanse of Golden Gate Park.

stops.name: Conservatory of Flowers
stops.description: A magnificent Victorian greenhouse built in 1879, making it one of the oldest buildings in the park.

stops.name: Music Concourse
stops.description: The cultural heart of the park, flanked by the de Young Museum and the California Academy of Sciences.

stops.name: Stow Lake
stops.description: A historic, man-made lake with a waterfall, perfect for a quick scenic pull-over or to rent a pedal boat.

stops.name: Bison Paddock
stops.description: Yes, there are actual bison living in San Francisco! A unique sight as you drive toward the western end of the park.

stops.name: Dutch Windmill & Ocean Beach
stops.description: The grand finale: a massive historic windmill standing guard as the park gives way to the vast expanse of the Pacific Ocean.
